            <li>The total amount of proceeds from transfer activity in that part of the reporting period?</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
</ul>
    [166] => <b>Hedge Accounting</b>
<p>An entity shall apply the disclosure requirements in paragraphs 21B–24F of IFRS 7 for those risk exposures that an entity hedges and for which it elects to apply hedge accounting. Hedge accounting disclosures shall provide information about:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>an entity’s risk management strategy and how it is applied to manage risk;</li>
    <li>how the entity’s hedging activities may affect the amount, timing and uncertainty of its future cash flows; and</li>
    <li>the effect that hedge accounting has had on the entity’s statement of financial position, statement of comprehensive income and statement of changes in equity.</li>
</ol>
<p>An entity shall present the required disclosures in a single note or separate section in its financial statements. However, an entity need not duplicate information that is already presented elsewhere, provided that the information is incorporated by cross-reference from the financial statements to some other statement. </p>
<p>When paragraphs 22A–24F require the entity to separate by risk category the information disclosed, the entity shall determine each risk category on the basis of the risk exposures an entity decides to hedge and for which hedge accounting is applied. An entity shall determine risk categories consistently for all hedge accounting disclosures</p>
<p>To meet the objectives in paragraph 21A, an entity shall (except as otherwise specified below) determine how much detail to disclose, how much emphasis to place on different aspects of the disclosure requirements, the appropriate level of aggregation or disaggregation, and whether users of financial statements need additional explanations to evaluate the quantitative information disclosed. However, an entity shall use the same level of aggregation or disaggregation it uses for disclosure requirements of related information in this IFRS and IFRS 13 Fair Value Measurement.</p>

    [167] => <b>Hedge accounting: The risk management strategy</b>
    [168] => Has an explanation been given of the risk management strategy for each risk category of risk exposures that it decides to hedge and for which hedge accounting is applied?
<p>This explanation should enable users of financial statements to evaluate (for example):</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>how each risk arises.</li>
    <li>how the entity manages each risk; this includes whether the entity hedges an item in its entirety for all risks or hedges a risk component (or components) of an item and why.</li>
    <li>the extent of risk exposures that the entity manages.</li>
</ol>
<p>To meet these requirements, the information should include (but is not limited to) a description of:</p>
<ul>
    <li>the hedging instruments  that are used (and how they are used) to hedge risk exposures;</li>
    <li>how the entity determines the economic relationship between the hedged item and the hedging instrument for the purpose of assessing hedge effectiveness; and</li>
    <li>how the entity establishes the hedge ratio and what the sources of hedge ineffectiveness are.</li>
</ul>
    [169] => When an entity designates a specific risk component as a hedged item (see paragraph 6.3.7 of IFRS 9), has it provided, in addition to the disclosures required by paragraphs 22A and 22B, qualitative or quantitative information about:
<ol type="a">
    <li>how the entity determined the risk component that is designated as the hedged item (including a description of the nature of the relationship between the risk component and the item as a whole); and</li>
    <li>how the risk component relates to the item in its entirety (for example, the designated risk component historically covered on average 80 per cent of the changes in fair value of the item as a whole)?</li>
</ol>
    [170] => Unless exempted by paragraph 23C, has the entity disclosed, by risk category, quantitative information to allow users of its financial statements to evaluate the terms and conditions of hedging instruments and how they affect the amount, timing and uncertainty of future cash flows of the entity?
<p>A breakdown that discloses the following must also be given:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>a profile of the timing of the nominal amount of the hedging instrument; and</li>
    <li>if applicable, the average price or rate (for example strike or forward prices etc) of the hedging instrument.</li>
</ol>
    [171] => Where an entity frequently resets (ie discontinues and restarts) hedging relationships because both the hedging instrument and the hedged item frequently change (see the example in paragraph B6.5.24(b) of IFRS 9) the entity is exempt from providing the disclosures required by paragraphs 23A and 23B.
<p>Instead, have the following been disclosed:</p>
<ul>
    <li>information about what the ultimate risk management strategy is in relation to those hedging relationships;</li>
    <li>a description of how it reflects its risk management strategy by using hedge accounting and designating those particular hedging relationships; and</li>
    <li>an indication of how frequently the hedging relationships are discontinued and restarted as part of the entity’s process in relation to those hedging relationships?</li>
</ul>
<p><i>When the volume of hedging relationships to which this exemption applies is unrepresentative of normal volumes during the period (ie the volume at the reporting date does not reflect the volumes during the period) an entity shall disclose that fact and the reason it believes the volumes are unrepresentative.</i></p>

    [172] => Has a description, by risk category, of the sources of hedge ineffectiveness that are expected to affect the hedging relationship during its term been given?
    [173] => If other sources of hedge ineffectiveness emerge in a hedging relationship, have those sources been disclosed by risk category and an explanation of the resulting hedge ineffectiveness been given?
    [174] => Has the entity disclosed, in a tabular format, the following amounts related to items designated as hedging instruments separately by risk category for each type of hedge (fair value hedge, cash flow hedge or hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation):
<ol type="a">
    <li>the carrying amount of the hedging instruments (financial assets separately from financial liabilities);</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of financial position that includes the hedging instrument;</li>
    <li>the change in fair value of the hedging instrument used as the basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness for the period; and</li>
    <li>the nominal amounts (including quantities such as tonnes or cubic metres) of the hedging instruments?</li>
</ol>
    [175] => <b>Fair Value hedges</b>
    [176] => In respect of fair value hedges, has the entity disclosed, in a tabular format, the following amounts separately by risk category:
<ol type="i">
    <li>the carrying amount of the hedged item recognised in the statement of financial position (presenting assets separately from liabilities);</li>
    <li>the accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustments on the hedged item included in the carrying amount of the hedged item recognised in the statement of financial position (presenting assets separately from liabilities);</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of financial position that includes the hedged item;</li>
    <li>the change in value of the hedged item used as the basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness for the period; </li>
    <li>the accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustments remaining in the statement of financial position for any hedged items that have ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses in accordance with paragraph 6.5.10 of IFRS 9;</li>
    <li>hedge ineffectiveness (ie the difference between the hedging gains or losses of the hedging instrument and the hedged item) recognised in profit or loss (or other comprehensive income for hedges of an equity instrument for which an entity has elected to present changes in fair value in other comprehensive income in accordance with paragraph 5.7.5 of IFRS 9); and</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness?</li>
</ol>
    [177] => <b>Cash flow hedges and hedges of a net investment in a foreign operation</b>
    [178] => For cash flow hedges and hedges of a net investment in a foreign operation, has the entity disclosed, in a tabular format, the following amounts separately by risk category:
<ol type="i">
    <li>the change in value of the hedged item used as the basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness for the period (ie for cash flow hedges the change in value used to determine the recognised hedge ineffectiveness in accordance with paragraph 6.5.11(c) of IFRS 9);</li>
    <li>the balances in the cash flow hedge reserve and the foreign currency translation reserve for continuing hedges that are accounted for in accordance with paragraphs 6.5.11 and 6.5.13(a) of IFRS 9;</li>
    <li>the balances remaining in the cash flow hedge reserve and the foreign currency translation reserve from any hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied;</li>
    <li>hedging gains or losses of the reporting period that were recognised in other comprehensive income;</li>
    <li>hedge ineffectiveness recognised in profit or loss;</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness;</li>
    <li>the amount reclassified from the cash flow hedge reserve or the foreign currency translation reserve into profit or loss as a reclassification adjustment (see IAS 1) (differentiating between amounts for which hedge accounting had previously been used, but for which the hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, and amounts that have been transferred because the hedged item has affected profit or loss);</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the reclassification adjustment (see IAS 1); and</li>
    <li>for hedges of net positions, the hedging gains or losses recognised in a separate line item in the statement of comprehensive income (see paragraph 6.6.4 of IFRS 9)?</li>
</ol>
    [179] => For cash flow hedges, has the entity given a description of any forecast transaction for which hedge accounting had been used in the previous period, but which is no longer expected to occur?
    [180] => Has a reconciliation been provided of each component of equity and an analysis of other comprehensive income in accordance with IAS 1 that, taken together:
<ol type="a">
    <li>differentiates, at a minimum, between the amounts that relate to the disclosures in paragraph 24C(b)(i) and (b)(iv) as well as the amounts accounted for in accordance with paragraph 6.5.11(d)(i) and (d)(iii) of IFRS 9;</li>
    <li>differentiates between the amounts associated with the time value of options that hedge transaction related hedged items and the amounts associated with the time value of options that hedge time-period related hedged items when an entity accounts for the time value of an option in accordance with paragraph 6.5.15 of IFRS 9; and</li>
    <li>differentiates between the amounts associated with forward elements of forward contracts and the foreign currency basis spreads of financial instruments that hedge transaction related hedged items, and the amounts associated with forward elements of forward contracts and the foreign currency basis spreads of financial instruments that hedge time-period related hedged items when an entity accounts for those amounts in accordance with paragraph 6.5.16 of IFRS 9?</li>
</ol>
<p><i>This information should be disclosed separately by risk category. This disaggregation by risk may be provided in the notes to the financial statements.</i></p>
    [181] => If an entity designated a financial instrument, or a proportion of it, as measured at FVTPL because it uses a credit derivative to manage the credit risk of that financial instrument, has it disclosed:
<ol type="a">
    <li>for credit derivatives that have been used to manage the credit risk of financial instruments designated as measured at FVTPL (see para 6.7.1 of IFRS 9), a reconciliation of each of the nominal amount and the fair value at the beginning and at the end of the period;</li>
    <li>the gain or loss recognised in profit or loss on designation of a financial instrument, or a proportion of it, as measured at FVTPL; and</li>
    <li>on discontinuation of measuring a financial instrument, or a proportion of it, at FVTPL, that financial instrument’s fair value that has become the new carrying amount in accordance with paragraph 6.7.4 of IFRS 9 and the related nominal or principal amount (except for providing comparative information in accordance with IAS 1, an entity does not need to continue this disclosure in subsequent periods).</li>
</ol>
    [182] => <b>Disclosure of Fair Value Measurement</b><p>Regarding IFRS 13 disclosures, an entity shall disclose the qualitative disclosures noted below in a tabular format unless another form is more appropriate [IFRS 13, paragraph 99].</p>
    [183] => Has disclosure been given that helps the user of the financial statements assess both of the following:
<ul>
    <li>For assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring or non-recurring basis in the Statement of Financial Position after initial recognition, the valuation techniques and inputs used to develop those measurements; and</li>
    <li>For recurring fair value measurments using significant unobservable inputs (Level 3), the effect of the measurments on profit or loss or OCI for the period?</li>
</ul>
<p>To meet this requirement, the disclosures noted in IFRS 13, paragraph 93 must be given as a minimum.</p>
    [184] => For each class of asset and liablity (determined in accordance with IFRS 13, paragraph 94) measured at fair value in the Statement of Financial Position after initial recognition, are the following disclosed?
<ol type="a">
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements at the end of the reporting period, and non-recurring fair value measurements, the reason for the measurement;</li>
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements; the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurements are categorised in their entirety (e.g, Level 1,2,3);</li>
    <li>For assets and liabilities held at the end of the reporting period that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis, the amount transferred between Level 1 and Level 2, the reason for those transfers and the policy for determining when transfers between levels occurred (transfers into a level should be discussed separately from transfer out of a level); a description of the valuation technique(s) and inputs used in the fair value measurement and if there has been a change in valuation technique, has this been disclosed along with the reason for the change;</li>
    <li>For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, have quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurements been discussed (this information does not need to be ‘artificially’ created when an entity uses prices from prior transactions or third-party pricing information without adjustment, however, quantitative unobservable inputs that are significant to the fair value measurement and are reasonably available cannot be ignored);</li>
    <li>For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, have quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurements been discussed (this information does not need to be ‘artificially’ created when an entity uses prices from prior transactions or third-party pricing information without adjustment, however, quantitative unobservable inputs that are significant to the fair value measurement and are reasonably available cannot be ignored);</li>
    <li>For recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, a reconciliation from the opening balances to the closing balances, disclosing separately:
        <ol type="1">
            <li>) Total gains and losses for the period recognised in profit or loss, and the line item(s) in profit or loss in which those gains and losses are recognised;</li>
            <li>) Total gains or losses for the period recognised in OCI, and the line item(s) in which those gains or losses are recognised;</li>
            <li>) Purchase;</li>
            <li>) Sales;</li>
            <li>) Issues;</li>
            <li>) Settlements;</li>
            <li>) Transfers into Level 3; and</li>
            <li>) Transfers out of Level 3.</li>
        </ol>
    </li>
    <li>For recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, the amount of the gain or loss for the period in (e)(1) included in profit or loss that is attributable to the change in unrealised gains or losses relating to those assets and liabilities held at the reporting period, and the line item(s) in profit or loss in which those unrealised gains or losses are recognised.</li>
    <li>For non-recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, a description of the valuation processes used by the entity;</li>
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, a description are the following disclosed:-
        <ul>
            <li>For all such measurements, a narrative description of the sensitivity of fair value measurements to changes in unobservable inputs, if a change in those inputs to a different amount might result in a significantly higher or lower fair value measurement.  If there are interrelationships between those inputs and other unobservable inputs in the fair value measurement, a description of those interrelationships and how they might magnify or mitigate the effect of changes in the unobservable inputs on the fair value measurement;</li>
            <li>For financial assets and financial liabilities, if changing one or more of the unobservable inputs to reflect reasonably possible alternative assumptions would change fair value significantly, is this fact disclosed, the effect of those changes and how the effect of the changes was calculated</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements, if the highest and best use of a non-financial asset differs from its current use, has this been disclosed and why the non-financial asset is being used in a manner that differs from its highest and best use?</li>
</ol>
<p>NB: Any analysis given above should either agree or be reconcilied to a line item in the Statement of Financial Position.</p>
